metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Count of integration pipeline runs that succeeded, failed, or were cancelled
metricSpecifications.name: IntegrationPipelineRunsEnded

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Count of integration activities that succeeded, failed, or were cancelled
metricSpecifications.name: IntegrationActivityRunsEnded

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Count of integration triggers that succeeded, failed, or were cancelled
metricSpecifications.name: IntegrationTriggerRunsEnded

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Count of login attempts that succeded or failed
metricSpecifications.name: BuiltinSqlPoolLoginAttempts

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Count of Requests that succeeded, failed, or were cancelled
metricSpecifications.name: BuiltinSqlPoolRequestsEnded

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Amount of data processed by queries
metricSpecifications.name: BuiltinSqlPoolDataProcessedBytes

metricSpecifications.displayDescription:
This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe.
 Resource utilization expressed as a percentage. High utilization indicates that the job is using close to the maximum allocated resources.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingResourceUtilization

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Total number of errors related to query processing (excluding errors found while ingesting events or outputting results).
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingRuntimeErrors

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of Event Hub Events (serialized messages) received by the Event Hub Input Adapter, received out of order that were either dropped or given an adjusted timestamp, based on the Event Ordering Policy.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingOutOfOrderEvents

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingInputEvents

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Amount of data received by the streaming job, in bytes. This can be used to validate that events are being sent to the input source.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingInputEventBytes

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events which application time is considered late compared to arrival time, according to late arrival policy.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingLateInputEvents

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events which application time is considered early compared to arrival time, according to early arrival policy.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingEarlyInputEvents

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events that could not be deserialized.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingDeserializationError

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of output events that could not be converted to the expected output schema. Error policy can be changed to 'Drop' to drop events that encounter this scenario.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingConversionErrors

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events sources backlogged.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingBackloggedInputEventSources

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of input events sources per second.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingInputEventsSourcesPerSecond

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Number of output events.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingOutputEvents

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: This is a preview metric available in East US, West Europe. Output watermark delay in seconds.
metricSpecifications.name: SQLStreamingOutputWatermarkDelaySeconds

operations.displayName: Read Big Data Pool diagnostic settings
operations.name: Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces/bigDataPools/providers/Microsoft.Insights/diagnosticSettings/read

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Count of Apache Spark pool applications ended
metricSpecifications.name: BigDataPoolApplicationsEnded

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Allocated vCores for an Apache Spark Pool
metricSpecifications.name: BigDataPoolAllocatedCores

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Allocated Memory for Apach Spark Pool (GB)
metricSpecifications.name: BigDataPoolAllocatedMemory

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Total Active Apache Spark Pool Applications
metricSpecifications.name: BigDataPoolApplicationsActive

operations.description: Gets the diagnostic settings for a SQL Pool
operations.displayName: Read SQL Pool diagnostic settings
operations.name: Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces/sqlPools/providers/Microsoft.Insights/diagnosticSettings/read

operations.description: Creates or updates the diagnostic settings for a SQL Pool
operations.displayName: Write SQL Pool diagnostic settings
operations.name: Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces/sqlPools/providers/Microsoft.Insights/diagnosticSettings/write

operations.description: Gets the available metrics for SQL Pools
operations.displayName: Read SQL Pools metric definitions
operations.name: Microsoft.Synapse/workspaces/sqlPools/providers/Microsoft.Insights/metricDefinitions/read

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Service level objective of the SQL pool
metricSpecifications.name: DWULimit

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Represents a high-level representation of usage across the SQL pool. Measured by DWU limit * DWU percentage
metricSpecifications.name: DWUUsed

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Represents a high-level representation of usage across the SQL pool. Measured by taking the maximum between CPU percentage and Data IO percentage
metricSpecifications.name: DWUUsedPercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Count of connections blocked by firewall rules. Revisit access control policies for your SQL pool and monitor these connections if the count is high
metricSpecifications.name: ConnectionsBlockedByFirewall

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Measures how well workloads are utilizing the adaptive cache. Use this metric with the cache hit percentage metric to determine whether to scale for additional capacity or rerun workloads to hydrate the cache
metricSpecifications.name: AdaptiveCacheHitPercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Measures how well workloads are utilizing the adaptive cache. Use this metric with the cache used percentage metric to determine whether to scale for additional capacity or rerun workloads to hydrate the cache
metricSpecifications.name: AdaptiveCacheUsedPercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Local tempdb utilization across all compute nodes - values are emitted every five minute
metricSpecifications.name: LocalTempDBUsedPercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Memory utilization across all nodes in the SQL pool
metricSpecifications.name: MemoryUsedPercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: CPU utilization across all nodes in the SQL pool
metricSpecifications.name: CPUPercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Count of Total logins to the SQL pool
metricSpecifications.name: Connections

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The active queries within the workload group. Using this metric unfiltered and unsplit displays all active queries running on the system
metricSpecifications.name: WLGActiveQueries

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Queries for the workload group that have timed out. Query timeouts reported by this metric are only once the query has started executing (it does not include wait time due to locking or resource waits)
metricSpecifications.name: WLGActiveQueriesTimeouts

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The percentage allocation of resources relative to the entire system
metricSpecifications.displayName: Workload group allocation by system percent
metricSpecifications.name: WLGAllocationBySystemPercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Displays the percentage allocation of resources relative to the Effective cap resource percent per workload group. This metric provides the effective utilization of the workload group
metricSpecifications.displayName: Workload group allocation by max resource percent
metricSpecifications.name: WLGAllocationByEffectiveCapResourcePercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The effective cap resource percent for the workload group. If there are other workload groups with min_percentage_resource > 0, the effective_cap_percentage_resource is lowered proportionally
metricSpecifications.name: WLGEffectiveCapResourcePercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The effective min resource percentage setting allowed considering the service level and the workload group settings. The effective min_percentage_resource can be adjusted higher on lower service levels
metricSpecifications.name: WLGEffectiveMinResourcePercent

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Cumulative count of requests queued after the max concurrency limit was reached
metricSpecifications.name: WLGQueuedQueries

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: The active queries. Using this metric unfiltered and unsplit displays all active queries running on the system
metricSpecifications.name: ActiveQueries

metricSpecifications.displayDescription: Cumulative count of requests queued after the max concurrency limit was reached
metricSpecifications.name: QueuedQueries
